etymology.interpretation: Jade (玉) supplies the meaning domain of jade or precious stones, while 其 contributes the pronunciation close to qí. The structure points to a jade-related word whose sound follows that of 其.

examples.chinese: 我认识一位叫王琪的老师(我認識一位叫王琪的老師)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ rènshi yí wèi jiào Wáng Qí de lǎoshī.
examples.english: I know a teacher named Wang Qi.

examples.chinese: 庭院里有琪花瑶草(庭院裡有琪花瑤草)。
examples.english: There are exquisite and rare plants in the courtyard.

examples.chinese: 她在玉器店挑选了一枚带“琪”字的吊坠(她在玉器店挑選了一枚帶「琪」字的吊墜)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài yùqìdiàn tiāoxuǎn le yì méi dài “Qí” zì de diàozhuì.
examples.english: She picked out a pendant with the character “Qi” at the jade shop.
